item.title: Alcohol-related Liver Disease
item.description: Alcohol-related Liver Disease Alcohol-related liver disease (ARLD) refers to liver damage caused by excess alcohol intake. There are several stages of severity and a range of associated symptoms.

item.title: Alcoholism
item.description: Alcoholism An alcoholic is one whose problematic patter n of alcohol use leads to clinically significant impairment or distress, manifested by multiple psychosocial, behavioural or physiological features.

item.title: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency
item.description: Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency An inherited disorder affecting lung ([[emphysema]]) and liver ([[Liver Cirrhosis]]). A1AT is a glycoprotein and a serine protease inhibitor made in the liver which controls inflammatory cascades.

item.title: Appendicitis
item.description: Appendicitis Most common surgical emergency - highest incidence between 10-20 y/os Causes/Factors Gut organisms invade the appendix wall after lumen obstruction by lymphoid hyperplasia, faecolith or filarial worms

item.title: Cholecystitis
item.description: Cholecystitis Inflammation of gallbladder Causes/Factors Age Obesity Smoking low fibre intake Symptoms Worsening of pain/symptoms after eating fatty food RUQ Pain Fever/$\uparrow$WCC Jaundice Biliary Colic $\checkmark$ X X Acute cholecystitis $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ X Cholangitis $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ nausea, vomiting RUQ pain - radiating round side / to back Signs Charcot’s triad - Fever + RUQ pain + Jaundice

item.title: Coeliac Disease
item.description: Coeliac Disease Coeliac disease is a condition where your immune system attacks your own tissues when you eat gluten. This damages your gut (small intestine) so reduced surface area to uptake nutrients

item.title: Crohn's Disease
item.description: Crohn’s Disease The inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), [[Ulcerative Colitis]] and Crohn’s disease are chronic autoimmune relapsing and remitting inflammation of the intestine.

item.title: Hepatitis
item.description: Hepatitis Hepatitis is the term used to describe inflammation of the liver. It’s usually the result of a viral infection or liver damage caused by drinking alcohol.

item.title: Liver Cirrhosis
item.description: Liver Cirrhosis Irreversible scarring of the liver. item.title: Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
item.description: Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) The commonest liver disorder in Western industrialised countries. A range of conditions caused by a build up of fat in hepatocytes.

item.title: Nutritional disorders
item.description: Nutritional Disorders Always consider that more than one nutritional disorder is likely to be present Scurvy - lack of Vitamin C Look for environmental signs (poor, pregnant, odd diet).

item.title: Ulcerative Colitis
item.description: Ulcerative Colitis The inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), ulcerative colitis and [[Crohn’s Disease]] are chronic autoimmune relapsing and remitting inflammation of the intestine.
